content.description: The question refer to the following declarations.
content.question: public class Point { private double myX; private double myyY; // postcondition: this Point has coordinates (0,0) public Point () { /* implementation not shown */ } // postcondition: this Point has coordinates (x,y) public Point(double x, double y) { /* implementation not shown */ } // other methods not shown } public class Circle { private Point myCenter; private double myRadius; // postcondition: this Circle has center at (0, 0) and radius 0.0 public Circle() { /* implementation not shown */ } // postcondition: this Circle has the given center and radius public Circle(Point center, double radius) { /* implementation not shown */ } // other methods not shown } In a client program which of the following correctly declares and initializes Circle circ with center at (29.5, 33.0) and radius 10.0 ?

choices.label: Circle circ = new Circle(); circ.myCenter = new Point(29.5, 33.0); circ.myRadius = 10.0;
Circle circ = new Circle(); circ.myCenter = new Point(); circ.myCenter.myX = 29.5; circ.myCenter.myY = 33.0; cire.myRadius = 10.0;

skill.text: 2.B: Write program code involving data abstractions.
